properties.areaDesc: Niobrara County; North Snowy Range Foothills; Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 2:17AM MST until February 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11
inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Near blizzard
conditions at times with these strong winds and moderate to
heavy snow.

* WHERE...Southeast Wyoming along and west of a line from
Lusk...to Chugwater...to Elk Mountain and Rawlins.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 5 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MONDAY TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY
